20 year old male presented to dermatology OPD with multiparous comedones. There is intercommunicating abscess, cyst with serosanguinous fluids or pus. Which of the following statement regarding the underlying condition is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Usually a/w flushing & intolerance to heat and spicy food

options.label: B
options.text: The underlying diagnosis is acne conglobate

options.label: C
options.text: Oral antibiotics and topical retinoids are the treatment of choice

questions.correct_answer: B. The underlying diagnosis is acne conglobate

questions.text: A 50 year old male patient presented to dermatology OPD with violet colored patch on wrist and dorsum of hand. The doctor noticed following characteristic lesions in the patient. Which of the above clinical condition is wrong?

options.label: B
options.text: Oral lesion shows a white lacework like pattern

options.label: C
options.text: Wing shaped projection of proximal nail fold onto nail bed, spitting and destroying called pterygium is seen

questions.correct_answer: D. Positive nikolsky sign is seen

questions.text: A lady presents with a history of burning sensation on eating spicy food. On examination bilateral white lacy streaks are present in buccal mucosa. There is no history of tobacco abuse but amalgamated third molar is present. What is the diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Intercellular deposits of IgG and C3

questions.correct_answer: C. Due to IgG against hemidesmosome
